names.toyama-prefectural-chubu-95927409: Toyama Prefectural Museum of Art and Design
names.beppu-city-kyushu-d264f5f0: Beppu City Traditional Bamboo Crafts Center
names.osaka-city-kanto-8e69c662: Osaka City Museum of Fine Arts

descriptions.awa-washi-awa-traditional-handmade-japan: Awa Washi is a traditional form of Japanese paper (washi) produced in Tokushima Prefecture, known for its durability and beautiful texture. Visitors can learn about the centuries-old papermaking techniques and try their hand at creating their own washi.
descriptions.french-restaurant-soin-kansai-b029cf10: A refined French restaurant in the Kansai region offering elegant cuisine crafted with local seasonal ingredients and traditional French techniques.
descriptions.wakayama-meditation-lunch-in-a-1-200-yea: Experience mindful meditation followed by a traditional Buddhist vegetarian lunch (shojin ryori) at a historic temple with over 1,200 years of history in Wakayama Prefecture.
descriptions.forest-adventure-iya-shikoku-87067ffb: An outdoor adventure park in the scenic Iya Valley offering treetop courses, zip lines, and obstacle challenges amidst the lush forest landscape of Shikoku.
descriptions.apricot-picking-apricot-processing-exper: A hands-on agricultural experience in Chubu where visitors can pick fresh apricots and learn to make traditional jam and other preserved goods.
descriptions.maiko-dancing-girl-and-geisha-dress-up-e: A cultural experience in Chubu where visitors can dress up in traditional maiko or geisha attire, complete with makeup and accessories, for memorable photos.
descriptions.hakuba-ex-adventure-chubu-7cfa0ce4: Hakuba EX Adventure offers thrilling outdoor activities including mountain biking, rafting, and hiking in the stunning Japanese Alps of Nagano Prefecture.
descriptions.hanamomo-no-sato-peach-blossom-village-k: A scenic village in Kuma Kogen Town famous for its stunning peach blossom displays during spring, offering beautiful walking paths through the orchards.
descriptions.paradise-in-the-sky-a-night-tour-of-the-: A guided night tour to one of Japan's best stargazing locations in the Chubu region, offering spectacular views of the Milky Way and constellations.
descriptions.higashikagawa-glove-gallery-shikoku-1748: A unique museum in Higashikagawa showcasing the city's traditional glove-making industry, which produces over 90% of Japan's leather gloves.
descriptions.cycling-chugoku-fdb64358: Cycle Hiroshima offers cycling tours and rentals to explore Hiroshima Prefecture's scenic coastal routes, islands, and historical sites including the famous Shimanami Kaido cycling path.
descriptions.epson-teamlab-kanto-ee41d680: teamLab Borderless at Azabudai Hills is an immersive digital art museum featuring stunning interactive installations where visitors become part of the artwork in boundary-free spaces.
descriptions.bingaki-wall-made-of-sulfuric-acid-bottl: Gallery Yamaguchi features a unique architectural element - a wall constructed from recycled sulfuric acid bottles, showcasing innovative repurposing of industrial materials into art.
descriptions.kimono-week-chugoku-bd9754a8: Hagi Castle Town is a beautifully preserved samurai district where visitors can rent kimonos and stroll through historic streets lined with white-walled buildings and traditional shops.
descriptions.waterfront-caf-s-along-chugoku-73360f54: Hiroshima Breakfast offers a selection of waterfront cafes along the city's picturesque rivers, perfect for enjoying morning coffee and local breakfast specialties with scenic views.
